faq.title: Academy Questions?
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about our riding programs

q1.question: What age can children start riding lessons?
q1.answer: Children as young as 5 years old can begin with our pony lessons. Ages 8+ can join regular beginner classes. We assess each child individually to ensure they're ready physically and mentally.

q2.question: How many lessons until I can ride independently?
q2.answer: Most beginners gain basic confidence in 6-10 lessons. However, everyone progresses differently. Our structured curriculum ensures safe, gradual advancement through skill levels.

q3.question: Do you provide riding equipment?
q3.answer: We provide helmets and safety vests at no extra cost. For regular students, we recommend purchasing riding boots and pants for comfort. We can advise on where to buy quality gear locally.

q4.question: Can I choose my instructor?
q4.answer: Yes! While we'll initially match you based on availability and skill level, you can request a specific instructor. Private lessons guarantee one-on-one time with your preferred coach.

q5.question: What's the difference between group and private lessons?
q5.answer: Group lessons (3-6 students) are more affordable and great for building confidence with peers. Private lessons offer personalized attention, faster progression, and flexible scheduling.

q6.question: Do you offer trial lessons?
q6.answer: Yes! We offer a discounted first-time trial lesson so you can experience our academy before committing. This includes horse introduction, safety briefing, and basic riding introduction.

q7.question: What if I miss a scheduled lesson?
q7.answer: With 24-hour notice, you can reschedule at no charge. Same-day cancellations forfeit the lesson unless due to emergency or severe weather. We recommend booking makeup lessons within the same month.

q8.question: Can adults with no experience join?
q8.answer: Absolutely! We have many adult beginners. Our adult programs focus on building confidence at your own pace in a supportive, non-judgmental environment. Age is just a number!
